DOC.brief_summary: Non-invasive repetitive bi-hemispheric transcranial direct current stimulation ( tDCS ) may restore post-stroke bi-hemispheric balance increase peri-lesional cortex activity suppress abnormal inhibition non-lesional hemisphere , therefore enhance after-effects rehabilitation . In double-blind , randomize control trial , investigator aim investigate whether multi-session , bihemispheric tDCS primary motor cortex ( M1 ) combination upper extremity rehabilitation therapy affect motor functional outcome , ipsilesional motor circuit excitability use transcranial magnetic stimulation ( TMS ) magnetoencephalography ( MEG ) measure .
DOC.brief_title: Repetitive Bihemispheric Transcranial Direct Current Stimulation After Stroke
DOC.detailed_description: Investigators consecutively enroll subacute ( 2-6 week stroke onset ) patient first-time , unilateral , ischemic subcortical stroke middle cerebral artery territory mild moderate hand weakness . All subject randomly allocate receive daily bihemispheric tDCS ( anodal tDCS ipsilesional M1 cathodal tDCS contralesional M1 2 mA stimulation 20 min ) daily sham tDCS ( stimulation 30 second ) simultaneous physical/occupational therapy , total 10 session . Changes upper extremity motor function score ( Fugl-Meyer test Action Research Arm test ) , corticospinal excitability transcranial magnetic stimulation ( TMS ) , sensorimotor oscillation magnetoencephalography ( MEG ) assess intervention , well 3 month stroke . All stroke patient receive tDCS standard medical , rehabilitation treatment rehabilitation ward .
